topic.title: Installation Options
topic.shortdesc: You can install Couchbase Server on Linux, Microsoft Windows, or OS X systems. These streamlined instructions will help you get up and running right away in a nonproduction environment so you can start learning how to use Couchbase Server.

section.title: Using Docker
section.p: Running Couchbase as a Docker container provides an easy, pre-configured server running in a virtual environment. Follow these simple steps to get started as fast as possible:

ul.li: Launch Couchbase container from Docker command line: docker run -d --name db -p 8091-8094:8091-8094 -p 11210:11210 couchbase/server:sandbox
Visit http://localhost:8091 and login as Administrator/password

section.title: Download and Install Server
section.p: For manual install and configure Couchbase on Windows, OS X, and Linux systems, follow the Quick Installation and Setup Guide.
